instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Various sensor errors TM0P TP0P TW0P Ta0P
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

Been previously cleaned (boo!) had backlight issues which have been resolved.

Fan is running full after about 10 seconds into boot.

EFI ASD gives following errors:

TM0P
TP0P
TW0P
Ta0P

Looked at <CHIP>U5870</CHIP> as this seems to deal with all of these.
Checked continuity to/from this chip checked all resistors which measure fine.

looked clean but Replaced <CHIP>U5870</CHIP> anyway as thought this would have to be it, but no change.
Checked <RESISTOR>R5323</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5361</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5360</RESISTOR> all measure fine and have continuity.

SMC looks untouched but may try reflow then US unless anyone has any ideas ?

Grateful as always for any help.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Various sensor errors TM0P TP0P TW0P Ta0P
threads.message: Voltage check on pin 1 of <CHIP>U5870</CHIP>? If ok then probably a SMBUS issue. Check diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL</SIGNAL> and SDA and trace all components on those lines and inspect for corrosion. Last thing would be SMC reflow/reball.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Various sensor errors TM0P TP0P TW0P Ta0P
threads.message:
Thank you Duke, that confirmed everything.

Slight variation in diode mode on the SCL / SDA versus a donor pointed me towards SDA.

It was <RESISTOR>R5360</RESISTOR> despite initially measuring ok. Once replaced all working. You may mark as solved Thank you again.
